Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel- Good Location”
Reviews.Author: fahademad
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 10 nights, and before I went there I was not sure about it! as I read many bad reviews. But once I was got my room ( 10th floor),I realized it is not a bad place..Room was clean, comfortable. Hotel location is very good, Walking distance from the Metro, shopping mall.. One thing I recommend if your deal not B&B, don't bother to take the breakfast in the hotel ( very average and expensive) you may take 3-5 min walk from many nice cafes which offer better breakfast for better value. Good Things: 1- Location 2- Free WIFI 3- Service 4-Value Bad Things: 1- Breakfast 2- A/C control Finally: I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Drgala
Reviews.Content: Excellent and professional service from the hotel crew,perfect bed,spacious room(superior room),nice view,wifi very quick without lost connectivity,large tv screen with satellite channels,quite,location of hotel is 5 min walk from metro sisli,modern area with starbucks coffee.Taxim square,sapphire tower and canyon mall which are top for visit are in a range of 2 metro stops.Special offers at bookin.Marmara chain hotel is gurantee for service in Istanbul. I was worried about the toilet door from previous reviews but there was one and indeed very good.The room was comfortable 23m2.One small problem is that the window let some minor cold to pass even when it was firmly closed but the room was in good temperature and had no problems with it.Breakfast was not inluded in the offer price.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel and a good value”
Reviews.Author: JB283
Reviews.Content: Pros: -located near a metro stop -great service -well designed and comfortable rooms -good food at the lobby restaurant -waterfall showerheads -reception workers had great english -quiet at night Cons: -rooms were hot and A/C was off for the season -a little far from the sites, 30 minutes by train system -restaurant servers sometimes struggled with english -inaccurate taxi approximate costs on their hotel information (off by 20TL in one case) We enjoyed our stay here, but due to its location, we probably won't stay again. We were more of a fan of the Sultanahmet side and it took 30-40 minutes to get there by train. If you like the Beyoglu district, thie location is just 2 stops away from Taksim.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vicktors79
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is not central but very close to the metro station (Metro and Tram in Istanbul are excellent!!!!!!!) so it is very easy and quick go to the city center (sultanahmet and taksim). All people that work in the hotel are very kind. Breakfast was hit the spot. The room are clean, enough spacious, elegant but enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “Cool design”
Reviews.Author: WilliamB123
Reviews.Content: Good Points; Design of the hotel is very nice, Location is good and quiet. Bad Points; Breakfast is overprice and below the average, there is no spa and no activity in the hotel. The best for who wants quiet stay.

Reviews.Title: “beautifull design”
Reviews.Author: gyarmath
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at this newly renovated hotel, it is situated close to the center, by car 15 min.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: stefano d
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in this hotel twice and i don't know why i want to stay there in again when i have a businness in Istanbul. Close to the transportation, lovely staff, good concept and best price. No doubt, come again

Reviews.Title: “A beatiful hotel with some faults”
Reviews.Author: arsemia
Reviews.Content: The Marmara ÅžiÅŸli, is a newly renovated hotel. It has a great design. The square plus room is spacious enough, the amenities are fine and cleanliness is average. The location of the hotel is just perfect for tourism and business. Metro, metrobus and public bus stops are around the hotel. You can reach even the most far areas of Istanbul using public transport, with a ticket fee around 2TL (and plus some transfer fees while changing the vehicles ~0.75TL). In spite of the good location and beautiful design of the hotel, many operations of the hotel are average if not terrible. The breakfast is very limited in terms of Turkish standards. A narrow variety of choice, with the same items everyday. Moreover, the hotel is eager to charge any additional item, without even mentioning that the item is extra beforehand. The staff is short, so you wait for everything in the breakfast, even for breads/bagels. Housekeeping is also another issue. There is a "please change my sheets" card to place on the bed. Even we have placed the card to change the bed sheets, we've found that sheets were not changed. So, in the middle of night we waited 30min. for the sheets be changed. Even though the hotel management is helpful for the problems, every time one problem is solved another one just popped up in our three-night stay. For me it was a very below-average hotel experience. That said, I would definitely recommend the hotel instead of over-crowded, tiny-room hotels in the Taksim area. The Marmara ÅžiÅŸli is would be a wiser choice over these ones. However, if you can afford, international chain hotels would definitely be more rewarding than The Marmara ÅžiÅŸli. In conclusion, the hotel needs a huge improvement in terms of uninterrupted service.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travelers, good for shopping...”
Reviews.Author: roadrunner82
Reviews.Content: Get the big rooms ! Third stay in the Marmara Sisli , got a Superior room which used to be called â€œsquare plusâ€� before , the hotel has got some improvements like English city& Shopping guides, more variety in small things like bathroom kits TV channels , etc â€¦with the good offers like stay 3 nights & pay for 2 it will be always competitive from a (value for money point of view ) â€¦ shopping malls like Javaher & Astoria are close , also 2 metro stations and 2 main bus stops are in a walking distance if you are public transport userâ€¦ PS: I have always been in relatively big rooms , I have heard that other rooms are very small . Negative points : cleanness of the rooms is good and maintained , whoever , more attentions most be given to that like the couches , mine was stained havenâ€™t felt commutable to use it , also the English language ability for some of the service staff will be helpful, I happen to know some Turkish so I managed my way , for others it might be difficult little bit to communicate Over all experience is good, my tactical suggestion is: Get a big room and check out the special offers!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Terrible room layout”
Reviews.Author: marmooraz
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Marmara Sisli is the location, Sisli is a nice neighbourhood in Istanbul, the hotel is 5 min walk from Istanbul most luxurious mall "Istanbul Cevahir" and the underground "Metro" station. I was shocked when I saw the room, it's designed as a sleeping train room, very narrow bed, no bathroom, the toilet, sink and shower are just scattered around the room with no closed doors. There was absolutely no space to put my luggage, not even a chair to sit on. One good thing to mention was the Air conditioning was working perfectly in July hottest days. ACs are a major problem in most of Istanbul 3 and 4 stars hotels and is something you really need to watch out for if you travel during summer. The cleaning was average, the bed sheets weren't changed daily but still my main concern is the size of the room and the fact that no closed bathroom exists. Stay at Marmara Sisli only if you are travelling alone or with friends and only if you get a good rate and plan to go back to the hotel only to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “IF you like GARBAGE,, The Marmara Sisli is a MUST !!”
Reviews.Author: MohammedPelin
Reviews.Content: First, can you believe a toilet with no door!!! YES, it is possible,,, exclusive in this hotel !!! Floor is the 5 star hotel for Bugs !! Towels never changed unless you ask for it which is not acceptable in a 4 Star Hotel!! and thats for you manager if you remember,,, that garbage bag left next to our bed !! yeah thats me !!!!! I never ever seen a hotel that leave a black garbage bag left after what is so called "room cleaning" Can you believe it a garbage left next to your bed,,, you dont find this in a one start hotel !!!! bed sheet and pillows never get changed and never get cleaned cleaned unless we ask for it,,, EVERYDAY !!!! Bathroom never get cleaned either,,,, you will see your hair left there all your stay I GUARANTEE this !!! I wanna slap the one who rated this hotel as a 4 star hotel Rooms are bloody small !!! and its too expensive for the service provided!! if you see a one star hotel please consider this as an alternative I am Turkish and I am so ashamed of this and I feel embarrassed of my country because The Marmara sisli exists !! you Manger I am the one who stayed in your Hotel from 19/6 - 26/6

Reviews.Title: “truly good place”
Reviews.Author: nemedMns
Reviews.Content: There's just nothing wrong with the hotel. I mean, it doesn't impress me with something special, it's just a what you need from hotel - clean and quite place to stay. Room could be a bit more spacious, but there's enough space to live in. Decor is good, everything was clean, quite, internet connection was good. People on reception are helpful. I put location to average because it's too far away from the old city and at the same time quite far away (2 metro stations) from business area at levent.

Reviews.Title: “GET AWAY”
Reviews.Author: asma19781978
Reviews.Content: I'm not finicky at all I've stayed in 3 stars hotels all over the world i even have stayed at motels i never ever have seen worse than this hotel there is nothing good about it TRUST ME the reality has nothing to do with the pictures . I booked this hotel for 10 days unfortunately i took a hot deal that was nonrefundable and although my credit card was fully chareged for the whole stay i could not stay for one hour at that disgusting worn out dirty room i left to another hotel at once I had to worry through out my vacation over going way over my budget and how will i deal with it when i go back home to reality but i did not regret for a second checking out of this hotel and if i'm in the same situation again i will do the same thing one important lesson not to book anything nonrefundable no matter what.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced hotel for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Phunky_Monkey
Reviews.Content: The Marmara are a well established chain of hotels in Turkey with a relatively good reputation which is one reason I chose this hotel. This hotel is not central to Istanbul but not too far out to be an issue, close to a tube station. Away from the busy touristy area so less street sellers to be harassed by. My room was â€œA compactâ€� room with a narrow corridor down the length of it â€“ that was the only floor space, so no chairs, tables etc. which was fine by me as I was alone but any more than one person in this room wouldâ€™ve been crowded. No door to the loo which was a bit odd, little hanging space for clothes â€“ luckily I was only there for a weekend. The staff seemed attentive and courteous â€“ I really had little reason for interaction other than valet parking. I didnâ€™t eat breakfast with the hotel as â‚¬15 seemed a little too pricey, besides, I prefer the cafes along the Bosphorus for breakfast â€“ canâ€™t beat the views. The room was clean & tidy, walls were not very sound proof so ambient noise was a bit of an issue â€“ even on the top floor. All in all I was happy with the Marmara Istanbul and would be happy to consider it again in the future â€“ but with so many others hotels to chose from, I think Iâ€™ll keep exploring ;).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location”
Reviews.Author: etekinbas
Reviews.Content: Here is compression between price and the values. Price+Location = Awesome Price+Comfort = Medium Price+Quality = Medium Price+Breakfast = Poor Tip: Do not try stay on Nano Room. Those rooms are very small and boring.

Reviews.Title: “too expensive for that what they offer in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ternound
Reviews.Content: breakfast is not special, small choise of food, , rooms not clean, roomservice is not reliable,

Reviews.Title: “Trendy design, boutique-level service, decent food and drinks. Bit of a quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: KristinCarlson
Reviews.Content: The price was right, place was clean, design memorable, and we had a good stay. Enjoyed the trendy design touches and contemporary lighting throughout this small hotel and its rooms. Good design for space saving and storage while still feeling airy and livable (we were in a mid-sized room). Nice food/drinks most of the time, but quality and ingredients were inconsistent. Service was helpful and kind, although we were given a sketchy exorbitant mini bar charge on our bill for things we never used (this was removed). Was walkable for our needs as this was a business trip, but in a quiet residential neighborhood requiring a long-ish cab or subway to any of the hip nightlife, restaurants, or tourist cultural sites you would want to investigate on a vacation trip. Also nowhere near the Bosphorous waterway which is so identified with being in Istanbul. The worst part was early morning noise of delivery trucks every day, to the point where we couldn't sleep. We were moved rooms but this was a problem throughout the whole hotel.

Reviews.Title: “sisli again”
Reviews.Author: suzziesue15
Reviews.Content: yessssssssssss here i am again staying in the sisli hotel :0) last time we stayed in wagon room....this time we booked for square room...woop wooooooooooo top room to book was sooo happy in it:0) well done SISLI XXXXXX

Reviews.Title: “quiet, safe location but not a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yerevan75
Reviews.Content: The Good: -- Quiet Location yet close to Metro station and largest shopping center in Turkey. -- A cheap, large supermarket is located 100 meters away. -- Nice views from the high floors. -- High speed WiFi internet connection The Bad: -- Thin walls and doors - you can hear your neighbors go in and out. -- Beds are smaller than usual (probably to fit into the smaller than usual rooms) The Ugly: -- The toilet has a metal water cable sticking out to fit into your.. bottom. As the toilet is smaller than usual (as are most things in this hotel) you can't avoid it - Ouch!

Reviews.Title: “Originally good”
Reviews.Author: Rothma
Reviews.Content: "3 days in Marmara Sisli were a total delight. The hotel is designed very originally and the room structure is the most impressive thing. I mean although there is no bathroom, practically, you have 2 spaces in the wall, closed with doors, of course, one as toilet, one as shower cabin. The idea is brilliant in terms of space saving! Breakfast was generous and nice, with a gorgeous view. I also liked the morning newspapers hanging on the door handle... Just accomodate in Marmara Sisli, take a good sleep in a great bed, wake up, order a cup of coffee and read your newspaper sitting in front of the wide windows facing the Istanbul landscape!"

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel staff I have ever experienced, staying oftern in 4 and 5 star hotels.”
Reviews.Author: jdtaia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 10 days. By the second day, everyone on the staff knew me by name. If I even thought I needed something it appeared. The Reception staff was only too happy to book restaurants, suggest restaurants and a font of information on Istanbul in general. The General Manager, Sinan Cayozu, suggested a private guide, something I had never done before. It was the best suggestion of the trip. We learned more about Istanbul intwo days than we would have in a month on our own. The afternoon Bellman, Yosuf, was amazingly helpful with everything from packing materials to tools to giving the taxi drivers very specific instructions. The Beverage Manager, Baris, we also amazingly helpful with tips on places to visit and general informaiton about Istanbul. One of the Reception staff in particular. I didn;t write down her name but dark hair with a bit of a Tennesse/Turkish accent in english, was great with restaurants and other geteral information. These are just the standouts, everyone was great. I was there for an American Institute of Architect's conference on Istanbul and I leared more from the hotel staff than from the conference hosts. I travel to Europe 3 to 5 times a year and this is the best I have ever been treated, even including 5 star resort hotel that cost 10 times as much a day. When I return to Istanbul, this will be my home for the trip.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: suzziesue15
Reviews.Content: i booked the sisli hotel because it is soo near shopping center.my partner lives in istanbul and i travel over to the bull as much as possibel..now we booked the wagon room and yessssssssssss they are very small for a long stay we was on top floor there is no door on the toliets and the thing is there was work men working on the roof,not a good sign :0( they should have at leasat warned us about work men on top...i have stayed at the marmara a good few times and pera as well in the marmara at least they put a note through your door iff windows are going to be cleaned...dont get me wrong sisli was ok but yes nano & wagon rooms very narrow and be aware no doors for toilet.. staff was good i can give it a 3* all mini bars are OTT

Reviews.Title: “3.7*”
Reviews.Author: ASO82
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel. I paid Â£58 for a double room without breakfast. Check-in was quick and easy. Room wasn't bad but nothing special. Bathroom was a little grubby. The bed wasn't that comfortable and moved about. The AC barely worked and it become quite hot in the room. Mini-bar prices are unreal high. Good location. A 5 minute walk to Cevahir shopping centre (biggest in Europe) and only two stops to Taksim, yet far enough away from the crazy mess that Taksim can be sometimes. If you're a football fan and happen to be staying on a game night, request a room on the top floor and you might be lucky to catch parts of the game from Galatasary stadium from your window.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, very helpful staff , Great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: roadrunner82
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 10 nights part of a business trip and a vacation, the location is great, although the hotel was built on a narrow square of land but the styli is very convenient. If you like shopping males and you want to be in Istanbulâ€™s center The Marmara Sisli is a very good choice, I had some business meeting in Levent which was 10 â€“ 15 minute only from Ortaklar street and I was able to walk once from Taksim Squire to the and it was a nice long walk throw the heart of European Istanbul. The hotel is good for business travelers and people who are willing to use Taxi for about 15 TL to reach the old town in Istanbul peninsula, the Squire rooms were ok with a nice view of modern Istanbul , I have heard the Nano and Wagon rooms are very narrow , but I havenâ€™t stayed in them . , the food quality was good but the mini bar needs to be maintained more. The chick in and out was fast and very good , the reception staff helped me in deferent occasions and they were nice and cooperative I can totally recommend the squire and the squire plus rooms and the hotel has Great value for your money .

Reviews.Title: “The poorest”
Reviews.Author: mamma_kattis
Reviews.Content: I have lived on many hotels but nothing so poor as this. Not a smile on 4dagar. The money goes before the could, but does not see the could one only intends on the money. We ordered wine day one and two costed it 11 lira day three costed it 19 lira which inflation! Some small but irritating the pointing out spirit, small rooms, a wine platen in the double room when one used it disappeared it pursue the whole sojourn? A tumbler that also disappeared after use?? A pair slippers to 2 persons. Katarina

Reviews.Title: “Way to poorly constructed building with cigarette smoke in the rooms and arrogantly rude staff.”
Reviews.Author: anders_hesselgren
Reviews.Content:
If you dont want to get robbed, dont order anything from the bar. We ordered four glases of wine of the house. Afterwards the man in the bar shoved us an opened bottle and said that he had served from this expensive wine. When we protested he grinned at us like we were fools. The shower overflowed.
Anders Hesselgren Sweden

Reviews.Title: “A good solid professionally-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelmoreLondon
Reviews.Content: I joined my partner, swho was attending a conference at a nearby hotel. for four nights at the Mamara Sisli hotel. The hotel is not in the main tourist area, and it is quite expensive to get there by cab (I didn't have adequate Turkish or stamina to test the public transport system). The hotel has everything you would expect from a hotel catering to business men and women. There is a good choice of food at breakfast, the hotel is clean, and our room was reasonably spacious. The receptionists didn't always seem to know what was going on in terms of how long we had booked for, but managed everything with minimum fuss. The main drawback was that the walls were very thin, you could hear everything if the person next door spoke in anything other than a quiet voice

HotelInfo.Name: The Marmara Sisli
HotelInfo.Address: Ortaklar Street No 30 Mecidiyekoy | SISLI, Istanbul 80290, Turkey
